en: The blind man felt his way toward the exit.
zh: 那个盲人摸索着往出口走。

en: There was nothing but water as far as the eye could reach.
zh: 一眼望去全是水。

en: As far as the eye could reach, nothing was to be seen but a field of wheat.
zh: 一眼望去全是麦田。

en: I thought my eyes were playing tricks on me.
zh: 我还以为我眼花了。

en: It's good to have the food cooked in front of you.
zh: 饭就在你面前做，感觉挺好的。

en: Tightly-knit carpets are generally more valuable.
zh: 织得密的毯子通常更值钱。

en: There was not a man without tears in his eyes.
zh: 每个人眼里都含着泪。

en: I met a keen-eyed guy.
zh: 我遇到个眼神特别犀利的家伙。

en: Some students looked at her with tears in their eyes.
zh: 有些学生眼里含着泪看着她。

en: Tears came to my eyes.
zh: 我眼泪流出来了。

en: What you see is what you want.
zh: 你看到的就是你想要的。

en: I got a bug in my eye and I can't get it out.
zh: 我眼里进了个虫子，弄不出来。

en: I got some sand in my eye.
zh: 我眼里进沙子了。

en: The number of visible stars is very great.
zh: 看得见的星星特别多。

en: The field was white as far as the eye could see.
zh: 一眼望去，田野里白茫茫的一片。

en: Out of sight, out of mind.
zh: 眼不见，心不烦。

en: Don't read under insufficient light, for it is bad for your eyes.
zh: 别在光线不好的地方看书，对眼睛不好。

en: Their eyes met.
zh: 他们的目光对上了。

en: By the look in your eyes, I sense that you have gotten your back up.
zh: 看你的眼神，我知道你生气了。

en: My eyes are brimming with tears.
zh: 我眼眶里噙满了泪水。

en: The pot calls the kettle black.
zh: 谁也别说谁，大家都一样。

en: My eyes get tired very easily.
zh: 我的眼睛特别容易累。

en: Her eyes shone as they reflected the light of the room.
zh: 她的眼睛映着屋里的灯光，亮闪闪的。

en: My eyes are tired.
zh: 我眼睛累了。

en: I have eyestrain.
zh: 我眼睛很疲劳。

en: My eyes are sore.
zh: 我眼睛酸酸的。

en: My eyes hurt.
zh: 我眼睛疼。

en: Eyes sometimes talk louder than words.
zh: 眼睛有时候比说话更有力。

en: My eyes are bloodshot.
zh: 我眼里全是血丝。

en: My eyes are very sensitive to the light.
zh: 我的眼睛对光特别敏感。

en: My eyes are very sensitive to light.
zh: 我的眼睛很怕光。

en: She dreads going blind because she's wearing thick glasses.
zh: 她戴着厚厚的眼镜，很怕自己会瞎掉。

en: A blind person's hearing is often very acute.
zh: 盲人的听力通常都很灵敏。

en: The blind nurse devoted herself to caring for the elderly.
zh: 那位盲人护士全身心地照顾着老人。

en: I awoke to find a burglar in my room.
zh: 我醒来发现屋里进了贼。

en: I awoke to find myself famous.
zh: 我一觉醒来发现自己出名了。

en: I awoke to find myself lying on the floor.
zh: 我醒来发现自己躺在地板上。

en: I awoke to find myself lying on the sofa.
zh: 我醒来发现自己躺在沙发上。

en: I awoke to find a bird in my room.
zh: 我醒来发现屋里有一只鸟。

en: I awoke to find myself completely refreshed.
zh: 我醒来觉得精神焕发。

en: When we awoke, we were adrift on the open sea.
zh: 我们醒来时发现正漂在大海上。

en: I awoke to find it snowing.
zh: 我醒来发现外面正在下雪。

en: When I awoke, it was snowing.
zh: 我醒来的时候，正在下雪。

en: I awoke to find my suitcase gone.
zh: 我醒来发现我的箱子不见了。

en: We need it when asleep as well as when awake.
zh: 不管是醒着还是睡着，我们都需要它。

en: To be awake is to be alive.
zh: 醒着就是活着。

en: It was almost noon when I woke up.
zh: 我醒来的时候都快中午了。

en: When I woke up, the day was breaking.
zh: 我醒来的时候，天刚蒙蒙亮。

en: I'm frantic!
zh: 我都要忙疯了！

en: I'm very busy.
zh: 我特别忙。

en: I'm so busy it makes my head spin.
zh: 我忙得晕头转向。

en: I'm afraid I have an inflammation in my eyes.
zh: 我看我眼睛是发炎了。

en: I can see the light.
zh: 我终于明白了。

en: The scales have fallen from my eyes.
zh: 我终于看清了真相。

en: My eyes smart.
zh: 我眼睛火辣辣的。

en: As far as the eye could see, there was nothing but sand.
zh: 一望无际全是沙子。

en: My eyes feel irritated.
zh: 我眼睛不舒服。

en: My eyes feel gritty.
zh: 我眼睛磨得慌。

en: My eyes feel itchy.
zh: 我眼睛好痒。

en: My eyes are itchy.
zh: 我眼睛很痒。

en: My eyes itch.
zh: 我眼睛痒。

en: I have bleary eyes.
zh: 我眼睛看东西模模糊糊的。

en: Your eyes are lying.
zh: 你的眼睛在撒谎。

en: I wish to exercise my right to remain silent.
zh: 我想行使我的沉默权。

en: Shut up, or I'll kick you out.
zh: 闭嘴，不然我把你轰出去。

en: He cannot speak well that cannot hold his tongue.
zh: 管不住自己嘴的人，话也说不好。

en: Shut your big mouth.
zh: 闭上你的臭嘴。

en: Just shut up and get on with your work!
zh: 闭嘴，赶紧干活儿！

en: You needn't suffer in silence.
zh: 你没必要一个人默默忍受。

en: You don't need to suffer in silence.
zh: 你不需要一个人硬扛。

en: Hold your tongue, or you'll be killed.
zh: 闭嘴，不然你就没命了。

en: Shut up and listen!
zh: 闭嘴，听我说！

en: Shut up and listen.
zh: 闭嘴，听着。

en: You have only to keep silent.
zh: 你只要保持沉默就行。

en: We interpret your silence as consent.
zh: 你不说话，我们就当你默认了。

en: Silence is an admission of guilt.
zh: 沉默就代表认罪。

en: I thought it best to remain silent.
zh: 我觉得还是不说话最好。

en: Being silent is regarded in effect as approval.
zh: 沉默其实就等于默认了。

en: Hold your tongue, or you'll be punished.
zh: 闭嘴，不然要受罚的。

en: Hold your tongue!
zh: 闭嘴！

en: Be quiet!
zh: 安静点儿！

en: Be quiet.
zh: 安静。

en: Don't talk.
zh: 别说话。

en: There was no need for verbal communication.
zh: 没必要用言语交流。

en: He judged it wiser to remain silent.
zh: 他觉得还是保持沉默比较明智。

en: You can save your breath. There is no use talking to him.
zh: 省省力气吧，跟他说话没用。

en: I see a house among the trees.
zh: 树丛里有个房子。

en: I would rather you came on Friday than on Thursday.
zh: 我宁愿你周五来，而不是周四。

en: Cease-fire talks concluded without progress Thursday.
zh: 周四的停火谈判没有任何进展。

en: I'll keep Thursday open for you.
zh: 我把周四的时间给你留着。

en: We should know the result by Thursday.
zh: 周四之前我们应该就能知道结果了。

en: Thursday night is free beer night.
zh: 周四晚上啤酒免费。

en: The trees began to come into leaf.
zh: 树开始长叶子了。

en: The trees are beginning to bud.
zh: 树开始发芽了。

en: The trees were bare of leaves.
zh: 树叶都掉光了。

en: The trees are already bare.
zh: 树已经光秃秃的了。

en: The leaves on the trees are falling by the wind.
zh: 树叶被风吹落了。

en: The leaves of the trees began to turn red.
zh: 树叶开始变红了。

en: The leaves on the trees have begun to turn red.
zh: 树叶已经开始变红了。

en: The leaves on the trees have begun to change colors.
zh: 树叶已经开始变色了。

en: The trees are in bud.
zh: 树发芽了。

en: The trees are putting forth leaves.
zh: 树长叶子了。

en: Cotton mittens will prevent the baby from scratching his own face.
zh: 戴上棉手套可以防止宝宝抓破脸。

en: The wooden pieces are fastened with a peg.
zh: 几块木头是用木栓固定在一起的。

en: Dr. Kimura gave me your name as the leading scholar in this field.
zh: 木村博士跟我介绍过您，说您是这个领域的顶尖学者。

en: Kimura jogged in the park every day.
zh: 木村每天都在公园跑步。

en: You also know Mr Kimura very well.
zh: 你也很了解木村先生。

en: You, too, know Mr. Kimura, don't you?
zh: 你也认识木村先生，对吧？

en: I met a Mr Kimura at the party.
zh: 我在派对上认识了一个姓木村的人。

en: I met a Mr. Kimura at the party.
zh: 我在派对上遇到一个姓木村的人。

en: A Mr Kimura is calling you.
zh: 有个姓木村的人找你。

en: There is a Mr. Kimura on the line for you.
zh: 电话里有位姓木村的先生找你。

en: A Mr. Kimura is calling you.
zh: 有个叫木村的人给你打电话。

en: Wooden houses easily catch fire.
zh: 木房子容易着火。

en: A wooden building can easily catch fire.
zh: 木建筑很容易失火。

en: Wooden houses catch fire easily.
zh: 木头房子很容易着火。

en: A house built of wood is more easily burnt than a house of stone.
zh: 木头建的房子比石头建的更容易着火。

en: A wooden house burns more easily than a stone house.
zh: 木房比石房更容易烧着。

en: Houses built with wood burn more easily than houses built out of stone.
zh: 木头造的房子比石块造的更容易烧毁。

en: The Kiso River is often called the Rhine of Japan.
zh: 木曾川经常被称为“日本的莱茵河”。

en: The smaller planets hovering around the planet Jupiter reminded him of the guards surrounding a king when he walked outdoors, and Kepler called them satellites.
zh: 围绕木星的小行星让他想到了国王出行时身边的卫兵，所以开普勒管它们叫“卫星”。

en: Wood is a disappearing resource in much of Africa, and these stoves burn far less wood than the stoves currently in much use.
zh: 在非洲大部分地区，木材资源正在枯竭，这些炉子比目前的通用炉子省木头得多。

en: Mr Kinoshita left his glasses behind in the office yesterday.
zh: 木下先生昨天把眼镜落在办公室了。

en: It was cool in the shade of the trees.
zh: 树荫底下挺凉快的。

en: I see an old woman under the tree.
zh: 我看见树下有个老奶奶。

en: We took shelter under a tree.
zh: 我们在树下避了会儿雨。

en: Don't break the branches.
zh: 别折断树枝。

en: The trees comforted me.
zh: 看到这些树让我心情舒畅多了。

en: You can't see the forest for the trees.
zh: 只看树木，不见森林。

en: The tree throws its shadow over the wall.
zh: 树影投在墙上。

en: Wood burns easily.
zh: 木头容易着火。

en: Wood floats, but iron sinks.
zh: 木头浮在水上，铁则会沉下去。

en: Wood floats in water.
zh: 木头在水里会浮起来。

en: I was caught in a shower on the way.
zh: 我在路上遇上阵雨了。

en: The tree spread its branches abroad.
zh: 树枝向四面八方伸展开。

en: The taller a tree is, the harder it is to climb.
zh: 树越高，越难爬。

en: The trees looked black against the sky.
zh: 在天空的映衬下，这些树看上去黑漆漆的。

en: A tree is known by its fruit.
zh: 看果实就能认出是什么树。

en: The tree bent down beneath their weight of fruit.
zh: 树被沉甸甸的果实压弯了腰。

en: The trees will soon be bare.
zh: 树叶快掉光了。

en: There was not a tree in sight.
zh: 一棵树也看不见。

en: There were few, if any, trees.
zh: 那里几乎没有树，就算有也很少。

en: The tree was so happy she could hardly speak.
zh: 树高兴得几乎说不出话来。

en: The trees are planted three meters apart.
zh: 树每隔三米种一棵。

en: The leaves turned red as the days passed.
zh: 随着日子过去，叶子变红了。

en: Leaves begin to fall in October.
zh: 十月叶子开始掉了。

en: The leaves of the trees turn red in the fall.
zh: 到了秋天，树叶会变红。

en: The leaves of the trees turn yellow in the fall.
zh: 到了秋天，树叶会变黄。

en: Leaves turn red in autumn.
zh: 秋天叶子会变红。

en: The leaves of the trees turn yellow in fall.

en: The leaves go brown in fall.
zh: 秋天叶子会变黄。

en: The leaves have all fallen.
zh: 叶子都掉光了。

en: Almost all the leaves went off the tree.
zh: 树上的叶子几乎全掉光了。

en: The leaves trembled in the wind.
zh: 叶子在风中抖动。

en: The leaves blew off.
zh: 叶子被风吹落了。

en: The leaves whirled in the yard.
zh: 叶子在院子里打转。

en: The leaves fell to the earth.
zh: 叶子掉到了地上。

en: Leaves lay thick over the ground.
zh: 地上铺了厚厚的一层叶子。

en: The leaves are turning red.
zh: 叶子正在变红。

en: The leaves began to turn red and yellow.
zh: 叶子开始变红变黄了。

en: The leaves of the trees have turned red.
zh: 这些树的叶子都变红了。

en: The leaves of the tree became red.
zh: 这棵树的叶子变红了。

en: The leaves on the tree have turned red.
zh: 树上的叶子变红了。

en: The leaves on trees have turned red.
zh: 树上的叶子都变红了。

en: Leaf after leaf fell to the ground.
zh: 叶子一片接一片地掉到地上。

en: I heard the leaves rustling.
zh: 我听见叶子沙沙作响。

en: Look at the bird singing in the tree.
zh: 看那只在树上唱歌的小鸟。

en: The cat on the tree came down to me.
zh: 树上的那只猫下树朝我走过来了。

en: We can see the tower above the trees.
zh: 我们可以看到树林上方的塔。

en: There are some boys under the tree.
zh: 树下有几个男孩。

en: There is a bench under the tree.
zh: 树下有个长椅。

en: I found some wild mushrooms under the log.
zh: 我在圆木下面发现了一些野蘑菇。

en: The bicycle under the tree is mine.
zh: 树下那辆自行车是我的。

en: I had to take shelter under a tree.
zh: 我不得不在树下躲雨。

en: I ran into a tree.
zh: 我撞到树上了。

en: The trees kept me out of the rain.
zh: 树林帮我挡了雨。

en: Let's take a little rest under the tree.
zh: 咱们在树下歇一会吧。

en: Branches are to trees what limbs are to us.
zh: 树枝对于树，就像四肢对于人。

en: He wanted to know more about the trees, too.
zh: 他也想多了解一下这些树。

en: There are some oranges on the tree.
zh: 树上结了些橙子。

en: The tree breaks the wind.
zh: 这棵树能挡风。

en: Don't you think it's rude to give people such a curt reply like that?
zh: 你不觉得那样生硬地回答人家很不礼貌吗？

en: Wood burns.
zh: 木头能烧。

en: The woodcutter fells a tree with an ax.
zh: 伐木工用斧头砍倒了一棵树。

en: The road was obstructed by fallen trees.
zh: 道路被倒下的树挡住了。

en: The tree fell down.
zh: 树倒了。

en: Too many trees deprive a house of light.
zh: 树太多了，挡住了屋里的光线。

en: Trees shelter my house from the wind.
zh: 树林为我的房子挡风。

en: The trees are shooting out buds.
zh: 树发芽了。

en: The leaves fell from the trees.
zh: 叶子从树上掉下来了。

en: Wood is made into various kinds of articles.
zh: 木头被制成各种各样的物品。

en: Wood can be made into all sorts of things.
zh: 木头可以做成各种各样的东西。

en: The tree was heard to crash to the ground.
zh: 听到那棵树哗啦一声倒在了地上。

en: Many trees fell down.
zh: 许多树都倒了。

en: We heard the tree fall with a crash.
zh: 我们听见那棵树哗啦一声倒了。

en: All's fish that comes to the net.
zh: 凡是到手的东西都有用。

en: The net got entangled in the propeller.
zh: 网缠进螺旋桨里了。

en: The net got entangled in the screw.
zh: 网被螺旋桨缠住了。

en: A nod is as good as a wink to a blind horse.
zh: 聪明人一点就透。

en: Guide dogs help blind people.
zh: 导盲犬帮助盲人。

en: I believe you have appendicitis.
zh: 我觉得你得了阑尾炎。

en: It appears that you have appendicitis.
zh: 看起来你好像得了阑尾炎。

en: Helping a blind man is an act of kindness.
zh: 帮助盲人是件善事。

en: Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
zh: 鲁莽的人往往会闯入智者不敢踏足的地方。

en: It is good that you do not have to study so hard.
zh: 你不用学得那么辛苦，真是太好了。

en: The hard work was worthwhile because I passed the exam.
zh: 辛苦一点也值得，因为我通过了考试。

en: A severe typhoon has done much damage to property.
zh: 强台风造成了巨大的财产损失。

en: How are you keeping off this intense heat?
zh: 这么热的天，你都是怎么避暑的？

en: We made good time until we ran into a blizzard.
zh: 在遇到暴风雪之前，我们的进度一直很快。

en: Beware of the dog!
zh: 小心有狗！

en: Clans run wild like a storm in a raging sea.
zh: 宗族势力如同狂风巨浪般横行。

en: May I have a blanket?
zh: 能给我条毯子吗？

en: Could you bring me a blanket?
zh: 能帮我拿条毯子来吗？

en: I'd like one more blanket.
zh: 我还想要一条毯子。

en: Can I get a blanket?
zh: 我能拿条毯子吗？

en: Please give me a blanket.
zh: 请给我一条毯子。

en: I believe that I had ordered a blanket.
zh: 我记得我刚才要了条毯子。

en: Take off your fur, and make yourself at home.
zh: 脱掉皮草，别客气，当成在自己家一样。

en: She is garbed in furs.
zh: 她穿着一身皮草。

en: I think it is cruel to trap animals for fur coats.
zh: 我觉得为了做皮大衣而去诱捕动物太残忍了。

en: Fur coats are on sale.
zh: 皮大衣正在打折。

en: The caterpillar turned into a butterfly.
zh: 毛毛虫变成了蝴蝶。

en: Do you want a trim?
zh: 你想修剪一下吗？

en: His bushy brows accented his face.
zh: 他浓密的眉毛让他的脸很有神。

en: Don't drag out Chinese sayings about the importance of an environment conducive learning just to justify moving house for a child's entrance exams!
zh: 别为了孩子升学搬家就拿“孟母三迁”那套说辞来当借口！

en: Making a model plane is interesting.
zh: 做模型飞机很有意思。

en: Making model planes is his only hobby.
zh: 制作模型飞机是他唯一的爱好。

en: It took me more than a week to put the model ship together.
zh: 我花了一个多星期才把那个航模拼好。

en: Making model spaceships is interesting.
zh: 制作航天模型很有趣。

en: Noodles are usually made from wheat.
zh: 面条通常是用小麦做的。

en: That's an interesting piece of information.
zh: 那条信息挺有意思的。

en: We might as well die as disgrace ourselves.
zh: 与其蒙受耻辱，我们还不如去死。

en: Any book will do as long as it is interesting.
zh: 只要有意思，什么书都行。

en: It's interesting.
zh: 真有意思。

en: This is interesting.
zh: 这个挺有趣的。

en: It seems very interesting.
zh: 看起来挺有意思的。

en: Beware that you don't get into trouble.
zh: 小心别惹麻烦。

en: It may seem like a hassle, but I think you ought to go back to the basics and start over. Haste makes waste they say.
zh: 虽然可能挺麻烦，但我觉得你还是应该从基础做起，毕竟“欲速则不达”嘛。

en: You'll get into trouble.
zh: 你会惹上麻烦的。

en: What a business it is!
zh: 真是个麻烦事儿！

en: I am afraid of having trouble.
zh: 我怕麻烦。

en: Do not trust such men as praise you to your face.
zh: 别相信那些当面夸你的人。

en: Don't trust people who praise you in your presence.

en: If it rains the day after tomorrow I'll be inside.

en: If it rains the day after tomorrow, I'll stay at home.
zh: 如果后天下雨，我就待在家里。

en: I must get my work done by the day after tomorrow.
zh: 我必须在后天之前把工作做完。

en: I must get this work done by the day after tomorrow.
zh: 这项工作我必须在后天之前完成。

en: I'll come back the evening after next.

en: Let's have a tea party the day after tomorrow.

en: The day after tomorrow I will urge my mother to leave an allowance of 10000 yen at my disposal.
zh: 我后天得跟我妈要一万日元的零花钱。

en: Come and see me the day after tomorrow.
zh: 后天来看我吧。

en: She will start for Kyoto the day after tomorrow.

en: He hasn't said so explicitly, but he's let it be understood that I was lying.
zh: 他没明说，但暗示他在撒谎。

en: The first point that requires clarification is that the design was purely experimental.
zh: 首先要说明的是，这个设计纯粹是实验性质的。

en: Four points need to be made.
zh: 有四点需要说明。

en: Clarity comes first.
zh: 清楚最重要。

en: She waved her hand to me, smiling brightly.
zh: 她灿烂地笑着向我招了招手。

en: It began to be light, and things were becoming visible by degrees.
zh: 天开始亮了，周围的东西渐渐都能看清了。

en: It's getting light. Morning is coming.
zh: 天快亮了，早晨要到了。

en: Let's put up the tent while it is still light.
zh: 趁着天还亮，咱们把帐篷搭起来吧。

en: Let's pitch the tent while it's still light.

en: The bright colors arrested our eyes.
zh: 那些鲜艳的颜色吸引了我们的目光。

en: The children's laughs spread throughout the forest.
zh: 孩子们的笑声传遍了整个森林。

en: Feel light at heart; feel happy.
zh: 感觉心情很轻松，挺开心的。

en: Clearly, she knows a lot about biotechnology.
zh: 显然，她对生物技术了解很多。

en: She was clearly satisfied with the results.
zh: 她显然对结果很满意。

en: It is clear that he knows the answer.

en: It was apparent that he did not understand what I had said.
zh: 显然，他没听懂我刚才说的话。

en: Obviously he is wrong.

en: Evidently, he's made a mistake.

en: Obviously, he's not that kind of person.

en: Obviously, he is to blame.

en: Someone is obviously telling a lie.

en: Obviously, someone is lying.

en: Clearly you are mistaken.

en: Clearly, this is the most important point.
zh: 很明显，这是最重要的一点。

en: Clearly, the rumor is not true.
zh: 显然，那个传闻不是真的。

en: Clearly, the rumor isn't true.
zh: 很明显，谣言是假的。

en: Obviously, they are jealous of his wealth and status.
zh: 显然，他们是在嫉妒他的财富和地位。

en: Obviously, he is lying.
zh: 很明显，他在撒谎。

en: It gets extremely cold toward dawn.
zh: 快到天亮的时候特别冷。

en: It was cold at dawn, so I put on another blanket.
zh: 黎明时分挺冷的，所以我又加了一床毯子。

en: Happy New Year!
zh: 新年快乐！

en: I can't reach the transom.
zh: 我够不着气窗。

en: I can't reach the skylight.
zh: 我够不着天窗。

en: Put out the light.
zh: 把灯关了。

en: Turn off the light.
zh: 关灯。

en: Put out the light and go to bed.
zh: 关灯睡觉吧。

en: Don't turn off the light.
zh: 别关灯。

en: Will you turn on the light?
zh: 能帮我开下灯吗？

en: The light shone like so many stars.
zh: 灯光闪烁，像星星一样。

en: Don't sleep with the light left on.
zh: 别开着灯睡觉。

en: The light went out by itself.
zh: 灯自己灭了。

en: The light went out and we were left in the dark.
zh: 灯灭了，我们陷入了一片漆黑。

en: Poor light hindered my reading.
zh: 光线太暗，没法看书。

en: The light came on suddenly.
zh: 灯突然亮了。

en: You left your lights on.
zh: 你忘关灯了。

en: They can't have gone out because the light's on.
zh: 他们肯定没出去，因为灯还亮着。

en: He must be at home as the light in on.
zh: 他肯定在家，因为灯亮着呢。

en: The light is on.
zh: 灯开着呢。

en: Where there is life, there is hope.
zh: 只要活着就有希望。

en: Where there's life, there's hope.
zh: 留得青山在，不怕没柴烧。

en: Life is dear to everybody.
zh: 人人都珍惜生命。

en: Life's seed is laid.
zh: 生命的种子已经种下了。

en: While there is life, there is hope.
zh: 只要活着就有希望。

en: While there's life, there's hope.
zh: 只要活着就有希望。

en: It's not the sort of illness that puts your life at risk.
zh: 这病没生命危险。

en: Do as I told you to do.
zh: 按我说的做。

en: I felt as if my life had been shortened.
zh: 我觉得我少活了好几年。

en: I found this at the risk of my life.
zh: 这是我冒着生命危险找到的。

en: As long as there is life, there is hope.
zh: 只要还有一口气在，就有希望。

en: He got angry because his honor was at stake.
zh: 他生气是因为他的名誉受到了威胁。

en: Please add my name to the list.
zh: 请把我的名字加到名单里。

en: Write your name in full.
zh: 请写下你的全名。

en: When you have written your name, write the date.
zh: 写完名字后，再写上日期。

en: Please have a seat and wait until your name is called.
zh: 请坐，等叫到你名字。

en: Did you hear your name called?
zh: 你听到叫你名字了吗？

en: My heart beat when I heard my name called.
zh: 听到叫我名字时，我心跳得厉害。

en: Those students whose names have been called will begin their exams.
zh: 被叫到名字的学生准备开始考试。

en: Stand up when your name is called.
zh: 叫到你名字时请起立。

en: Please tell me your name.
zh: 请告诉我你叫什么名字。

en: I quite forget your name.
zh: 我完全忘了你叫什么了。

en: A writer, whose name I have forgotten, wrote this novel.
zh: 有个作家写了这部小说，但我忘了他的名字。

en: My name is Ichiro Tanaka.
zh: 我叫田中一郎。

en: I don't know her name, but I do know her by sight.
zh: 我不知道她叫什么，但看着面熟。

en: Although the names are similar, they are far from being the same.
zh: 虽然名字挺像，但完全不是一回事。

en: What is his name?
zh: 他叫什么？

en: What's its name?

en: Her name was Linda, and she was a year younger than Tony.
zh: 她叫琳达，比托尼小一岁。

en: I'm not sure of the name, but the extension is 211.
zh: 我不确定名字，但分机号是211。

en: All the names are listed in alphabetical order.
zh: 所有名字都是按字母顺序排列的。

en: There has been a little confusion of names.
zh: 名字上出了点小差错。

en: Name and address, please.
zh: 请报一下姓名和地址。

en: I only know him by name.
zh: 我只听说过他的名字。

en: Don't make fun of him because he cannot write his name.
zh: 别因为他不会写自己的名字就笑话他。

en: When you have written your name, please write the date.
zh: 写完名字后，请写上日期。

en: I heard my name called.
zh: 我听到有人叫我名字。

en: Answer to your name when it is called.
zh: 叫到你名字时请答应一声。

en: It is hard to maintain one's reputation.
zh: 名声很难维持。

en: Some people go after fame.
zh: 有些人追逐名声。

en: Don't chase after fame.
zh: 别只顾着追求名声。

en: Fame is not always an accompaniment of success.
zh: 成名并不一定意味着成功。

en: It is very hard to live up to your reputation.
zh: 要做到名副其实真的很不容易。

en: Despite all his fame, he is not happy.
zh: 尽管他很有名，但他并不开心。

en: It is wrong to aim at fame only.
zh: 只追求名声是不对的。

en: I'm seeing all the sights.
zh: 我正在四处观光。

en: There were too many sights to see in a day or two.
zh: 一两天的时间根本看不过来这么多景点。

en: Sometimes a verb is derived from a noun and sometimes it is the other way around.
zh: 有时候动词是从名词变来的，有时候则相反。

en: Nagoya is between Tokyo and Osaka.
zh: 名古屋在东京和大阪之间。

en: Nagoya is a city which is famous for its castle.
zh: 名古屋是一座以城堡闻名的城市。

en: Nagoya is a city famous for its castle.
zh: 名古屋是一座以古城出名的城市。

en: Nagoya is a city that's famous for its castle.
zh: 名古屋是一座以城堡出名的城市。

en: Nagoya is to the east of Kyoto.
zh: 名古屋在京都的东边。

en: I usually have to change my clothes two or three times a day during the hot summer in Nagoya.
zh: 名古屋夏天特别热，我一天通常得换两三次衣服。

en: What's the stop after Nagoya?
zh: 名古屋下一站是哪儿？

en: In Nagoya summers a fan is essential to help stay cool.
zh: 名古屋夏天得有把扇子降降温。

en: Can you stand the summer heat in Nagoya?

en: Nagoya lies between Tokyo and Osaka.
zh: 名古屋在东京和大阪之间。

en: Speaking of Nagoya, have you ever been to Seto?

en: Finding one's way around Nagoya is very simple. All you do is look at the signs.
zh: 在名古屋认路特别简单，看路牌就行。

en: I took over the wheel at Nagoya.
zh: 到了名古屋换我来开车。

en: A good idea occurred to me.
zh: 我突然想到了一个好主意。

en: A good idea suddenly struck her.

en: A great idea presented itself in my mind.

en: Profit is better than fame.

en: A good idea occurred to me last night.
zh: 昨天晚上我想到了一个好主意。

en: Everybody who is anybody was present at the reception.
zh: 有头有脸的人物都出席了招待会。

en: The nether gate was opened.
zh: 阴间的大门打开了。

en: The daughters recuperated from the shock of the death of their father.
zh: 女儿们从父亲去世的打击中缓过劲来了。

en: It isn't that both daughters want to study abroad.
zh: 并不是两个女儿都想出国留学。

en: I entered my daughter in a girl's school.
zh: 我送我女儿进了一所女校。

en: Can my daughter go to school?

en: My daughter will come of age next year.

en: My daughter is the apple of my eye.

en: My daughter was premature.

en: The girl begged her mother to accompany her.
zh: 那女孩求她妈妈陪她一起。

en: My daughter weighed eight pounds at birth.
zh: 我女儿出生时八磅重。

en: My daughter has braces.

en: My daughter held on to my coat sleeve and would not let me go.
zh: 我女儿抓着我的外套袖子不放，不让我走。

en: Our daughter is none the better because we've been nursing.
zh: 虽然我们一直在护理，但女儿的情况并没有好转。

en: My daughter has grown into a dress my wife used to wear.

en: My daughter will come of age this year.
zh: 我女儿今年就成年了。

en: My daughter prefers science to languages or art.
zh: 比起语言或艺术，我女儿更喜欢理科。

en: My daughter is barely fifteen.
zh: 我女儿才刚满十五岁。

en: Her father is liberal with money.
zh: 她父亲花钱挺大方的。

en: I'd like to have her teeth straightened.
zh: 我想给她整整牙。

en: My daughter is cutting her permanent teeth.
zh: 我女儿在换恒牙。

en: The girls' chatter was endless.
zh: 女孩子们叽叽喳喳说个没完。

en: Wondering if my daughter had arrived safely I tried to call her but couldn't get through.
zh: 我想知道女儿平安到了没，就试着给她打了个电话，但没打通。

en: We have decided to leave our daughter to herself after she left school.
zh: 我们决定在女儿毕业以后就不再管她了。

en: The return of his daughter brightened his life.

en: I think my daughter's coming down with something.

en: Our daughter burned her finger with a match.

en: My daughter came to see me from time to time.
zh: 我女儿偶尔会来看我。

en: He can't help his daughter being so foolish.

en: He had one daughter.
zh: 他有一个女儿。

en: The land could just be discerned through the mist.
zh: 透过薄雾，隐约能看见陆地。

en: Fog was a familiar sight in London.

en: The fog won't clear until there's a wind to blow it away.
zh: 没风的话，这雾散不了。

en: A boat suddenly appeared out of the mist.
zh: 雾里突然钻出来一艘船。

en: We could see nothing but fog.
zh: 除了大雾，我们什么也看不见。

en: Railroad service was suspended because of the fog.
zh: 因为大雾，铁路停运了。

en: The mountain was blurred by fog.
zh: 山被大雾笼罩，模糊不清。

en: Due to the fog, traffic is temporarily suspended.
zh: 因为大雾，交通暂时中断了。

en: The fog prevented the planes from taking off.
zh: 雾大得飞机都没法起飞。

en: The valley was hidden from view in the mist.

en: Fog has limited visibility to 100 meters.
zh: 雾大得能见度不到100米。

en: The girl disappeared in the misty forest.
zh: 那个女孩消失在雾蒙蒙的森林里了。

en: The fog closed in.

en: A curtain of mist blocked our view.

en: The fog is getting thicker.
zh: 雾越来越大了。

en: It was foggy, so it was hard to make out the figures of people walking.
zh: 雾很大，看不清路人的身影。

en: The fog was thickening quickly.
zh: 雾很快就变浓了。

en: The fog has lifted.
zh: 雾散了。

en: The fog is growing thicker.
zh: 雾越来越浓了。

en: The mist was so dense that I could not see even an inch ahead.
zh: 雾大得伸手不见五指。

en: I hope the fog will go away soon.
zh: 我希望雾快点散掉。

en: Conflicting reports prompted the director to reconsider her position.
zh: 各种矛盾的报道让主管开始重新考虑她的立场。

en: Is it free?
zh: 这个免费吗？

en: They're giving away samples free.
zh: 他们在免费发放样品。

en: It's for free.
zh: 这是免费的。

en: It's free.
zh: 免费的。

en: This is free.
zh: 这个是免费的。

en: That's free.
zh: 那个是免费的。

en: You may get it free of charge.
zh: 你可以免费领取。

en: I don't wanna press you.
zh: 我不想逼你。

en: You must think it's impossible, but could you at least give it a try?
zh: 你肯定觉得不可能，但能不能至少试一下？

en: Don't exert yourself.
zh: 别太累着自己。

en: Where might is master, justice is servant.
zh: 强权之下无公义。

en: You're bound to feel that way at first, I guess.
zh: 我想，你刚开始肯定会那样觉得。

en: It's reasonable that you feel that way at first.
zh: 刚开始有那种感觉很正常。

en: I'm not asking for the moon.
zh: 我又不是要天上的星星。

en: It's not an impossible request.
zh: 这个要求并不过分。

en: I don't think she could spare the time because she is always busy with her work.
zh: 她工作一直很忙，我觉得她抽不出时间。

en: Don't work too hard!
zh: 别太拼命了！

en: Try to avoid overdoing it.
zh: 尽量别做过头。

en: Don't overexert yourself.
zh: 别太劳累了。

en: You should take it easy.
zh: 你得放轻松点。

en: The strain is beginning to tell on him.
zh: 这种压力已经开始影响到他了。

en: Might makes right.
zh: 强权即公理。

en: The reckless men froze to death during their expedition to the Antarctic.
zh: 那些鲁莽的人在南极探险时冻死了。

en: The two men were arrested for reckless driving.
zh: 那两个人因为危险驾驶被抓了。

en: Making love to an expressionless woman is like sipping soup without any seasoning.
zh: 和一个木然的女人亲热就像喝没放调料的汤。

en: He is riding for a fall.
zh: 他这是在自讨苦吃。

en: Plain white paper will do.
zh: 白纸就行。

en: I shouldn't have overdone it.
zh: 我真不该做过头。

en: You should not be absent without notice.
zh: 你不该不打招呼就不来。

en: Ignorance is bliss.
zh: 无知便是福。

en: You must not park your car there without permission.
zh: 未经许可不能在那停车。

en: It was a wild goose chase.
zh: 那纯粹是白忙活一场。

en: It's high time you stopped wasting your money.
zh: 你早该停止乱花钱了。

en: So use it wisely and don't waste it.
zh: 所以要省着点用，别浪费。

en: Don't waste your breath.
zh: 别白费口舌了。

en: Don't waste your money.
zh: 别乱花钱。

en: We are working hard to make up for lost time.
zh: 我们正拼命把耽误的时间补回来。

en: We're working hard to make up for lost time.
zh: 我们在努力赶进度，想把耽误的时间补回来。

en: It is difficult to make up for wasted time.
zh: 浪费掉的时间很难补回来。

en: Why don't you make up for the lost time?
zh: 你怎么不把耽误的时间补上？

en: All you need to do is get back the time you have wasted.
zh: 你只要把浪费的时间找回来就行。

en: You must make up for lost time.
zh: 你得把耽误的时间补回来。

en: I do not want to exert myself in vain.
zh: 我不想白忙活。

en: It's useless to try and resist.
zh: 反抗也没用。

en: It seems appropriate to apply these rules to the voiceless consonants.
zh: 把这些规则用在清辅音上好像挺合适的。

en: Thousands of small businesses went under during the recession.
zh: 经济衰退期间，成千上万的小企业都倒闭了。

en: The irreligious scoffed at the bishop's interpretation.
zh: 那些不信教的人对主教的解释嗤之以鼻。

en: We agreed to the plan without qualification.
zh: 我们无条件地同意了这个计划。

en: Hard as he was, his eyes filled with tears.
zh: 尽管他很坚强，眼里还是充满了泪水。

en: What is it like to be innocent?
zh: 清白无辜是什么感觉？

en: Unable to prove his innocence, he was forced to leave his native town.
zh: 因为没法证明自己的清白，他只好离开了家乡。

en: Do you believe his statement that he is innocent?

en: Nobody will believe his assertion that he is innocent.
zh: 没人会相信他自称清白的话。

en: I was relieved to hear that you had arrived safely.
zh: 听说你平安到了，我也就放心了。

en: There were few passengers who were safe.
zh: 乘客中没几个是平安无事的。

en: I felt left out.

en: I was admitted to school without having to take an entrance examination.
zh: 我免试入学了。

en: An innocent man was arrested by mistake.
zh: 一个无辜的人被错抓了。

en: Of course, innocent people were released.
zh: 当然，清白的人都被放了。

en: Who is silent is held to consent.
zh: 沉默就代表默认。

en: I like him all the more for his reticence.
zh: 正因为他话少，我反而更喜欢他。

en: No silence was ever written down.
zh: 沉默是无法记录在案的。

en: The eerie silence struck terror into their hearts.
zh: 那种死寂让他们感到毛骨悚然。

en: I have nothing to do with that.
zh: 那事跟我没关系。

en: Refuse to take no answer.
zh: 不答应就不罢休。

en: I'd like a full tank of regular unleaded.
zh: 普通无铅汽油，加满。

en: Ten dollars of regular unleaded, please.
zh: 请加10块钱的普通无铅汽油。

en: If you are idle, be not solitary, if you are solitary, be not idle.
zh: 闲时莫独处，独处莫闲着。

en: She was very glad to find the purse she had given up for lost.
zh: 找回了本以为丢了的钱包，她高兴坏了。

en: Where is the missing dollar?
zh: 差的那一块钱哪儿去了？

en: Nothing can come of nothing.
zh: 无中不能生有。

en: Nothing comes from nothing.
zh: 无中不能生有。

en: You can't spend what you don't have.
zh: 没钱就没法花。

en: Get the dream.
zh: 去追梦吧。

en: I've steeled myself to face a certain amount of sacrifice, effort and hardship if that's what it takes to fulfill my dream.
zh: 为了实现梦想，我已经做好了吃苦、努力和牺牲的准备。

en: It's like a dream come true.
zh: 这就像美梦成真一样。

en: It's like a dream.
zh: 简直跟做梦一样。

en: My dream has come true.
zh: 我的梦想实现了。

en: My dream came true.
zh: 我的美梦成真了。

en: Our dreams came true.
zh: 我们的梦想都实现了。

en: The dream came true.
zh: 梦想成真了。

en: One's dreams do not always come true.
zh: 梦想并不总是能实现的。

en: Dreams sometimes come true.
zh: 梦想有时也会成真。
